TITLE: A 5.9% increase to Social Security benefits takes effect this month. Here’s what to expect
SUMMARY: Social Security benefits are poised to get the largest annual increase in decades. Here's what beneficiaries can expect when those checks start this month.

TITLE: Have Covid? You can’t get unemployment benefits
SUMMARY: Americans who get Covid and miss work aren't eligible for unemployment benefits. That wasn't the case earlier in the pandemic.

TITLE: Retirees need to keep this much cash, advisors say
SUMMARY: As retirees kick off the new year, high inflation and strong market returns may leave many wondering how much cash they need to have handy.

TITLE: There are times when it makes sense to sell stocks. Here are some of them
SUMMARY: The less you look at your investment account, the better. Yet there are points in an investor's journey when they need to stop and reevaluate.

TITLE: Auto insurance is expected to cost 5% more in 2022. Here's where it's the most and least expensive
SUMMARY: For 2022, the average national premium for annual car insurance is expected to jump 5% to $1,707, up from $1,663 in 2021, research shows.

TITLE: Verdict in fraud case of Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes offers lessons for investors
SUMMARY: Theranos isn’t the only bad apple out there. Here’s how you can protect yourself and your portfolio from corporate fraud.

TITLE: Gen Z and millennials pay three times as much in banking fees than older generations
SUMMARY: Younger generations of Americans are focused on convenience over products and services offered by banking institutions, a survey from Bankrate finds.

TITLE: Now’s the time to boost 401(k) contributions for 2022
SUMMARY: You can funnel $20,500 into your 401(k) plan for 2022, up from $19,500 from 2021. Here's why it may pay off to boost contributions now.

TITLE: Families who got the child tax credit last year need to watch for this letter from the IRS
SUMMARY: The IRS will be sending Letter 6419, which shows how much families received in advanced child tax credit payments, in January.

TITLE: Here is the age when many Americans hope to retire
SUMMARY: "How soon can I retire?" is a question on many Americans' lips. Even as a recent survey shows many workers want to retire earlier, there can be reasons to wait.

TITLE: Powerball's jackpot surges to $540 million — yet doesn't even crack the list of 10 largest lottery wins
SUMMARY: Between Powerball and Mega Millions, the top 10 largest jackpots ever won range from $648 million to nearly $1.6 billion.

TITLE: 25 million people got unemployment benefits in 2021. They won't be getting a tax break
SUMMARY: The American Rescue Plan Act waived federal tax on 2020 unemployment benefits. A similar break isn't available this coming tax season.

TITLE: Many Americans aren't optimistic about their financial situation this year. Here's what they blame
SUMMARY: Rising prices have many Americans worried about their financial future.

TITLE: 5 ways to reset your retirement savings and save more in 2022
SUMMARY: The new year brings opportunities for many Americans in their careers and financial lives.

TITLE: Don’t count on that tax refund yet. Why it may be smaller this year
SUMMARY: If you’re hoping for a tax refund, it may be smaller, or you may owe money this season, according to financial experts. Here’s what filers need to know.

TITLE: Waiting for student loan forgiveness? Here's what to do in the meantime
SUMMARY: Student loan forgiveness could be coming. These are the steps borrowers should and shouldn't take before there's more news.

TITLE: 10 things that will be more expensive in 2022
SUMMARY: Prices are going up in the year ahead. Here's what's going to be more expensive and how to navigate paying more for the things you want.

TITLE: Here's what to know about your 2022 Medicare costs
SUMMARY: With annual adjustments pushing some costs higher, experts say it's important to consider how the changes will affect your household spending.

TITLE: To make your financial New Year's resolutions stick, here's what you need to do
SUMMARY: It's easy to come up with New Year's resolutions and even easier to break them. Experts give their advice on how to stay on track.

TITLE: Financial help can lead to happiness. How to find the right professional for you
SUMMARY: People who worked with a financial advisor were found to be nearly three times happier than those who didn't, according to a study by Herbers & Company.

TITLE: Bitcoin slump offers tax play for investors — for now
SUMMARY: Bitcoin and other crypto investors who lost money in December can leverage a tax loophole for a benefit.

TITLE: Here's where Americans want to travel abroad — and where they're losing interest
SUMMARY: Americans have never stopped dreaming about vacations abroad. Travel site ParkSleepFly analyzed Google search data to track where we'd like to go.

TITLE: How to walk out of the grocery store with a smaller bill
SUMMARY: If rising food costs have you worried, here are some money-saving tips for feeding your family.

TITLE: Powerball's top prize jumps to $500 million for the first drawing of 2022. This year, winners landed jackpots totaling $2 billion
SUMMARY: Powerball's last drawing of 2021 was Wednesday night, capping a year that had six winning jackpots worth an aggregate $2 billion.

TITLE: Didn't max out your IRA this year? There's still time in 2022
SUMMARY: Retirement savers have until April 15, 2022 to maximize 2021 contributions to individual retirement accounts.

TITLE: Unemployment claims end 2021 near pre-pandemic levels
SUMMARY: Claims for unemployment benefits in December were roughly four times less than at the beginning of 2021. The Covid-19 omicron variant threatens those gains.

TITLE: Don't forget to tend to your 401(k) if you join the 'Great Resignation'
SUMMARY: Depending on your account balance and your employer's policy, you may have options for how to handle the money.

TITLE: Here's where stock investors should consider putting their money in 2022
SUMMARY: While many experts expect lower returns next year, there are some parts of the market that may outperform others.

TITLE: The rich benefit as Democrats retreat from tax on unrealized capital gains
SUMMARY: The Build Back Better package omits taxes on unsold, appreciated assets, which Democrats had eyed in earlier rounds of negotiations.

TITLE: Student loan payments keep getting delayed. Will the debt ever be forgiven?
SUMMARY: The payment pause for student loan borrowers has been extended five times during the pandemic. Advocates say it's time for deeper relief.
